moves.4... Nc6 5. d5 Nb4 6. a3 Na6 7. b4 Bg4 8: This was to close up the queenside
moves.17. Qd3 f5 18. f3 Ng3 19. Rfe1 e4 20. fx: My bishop doing the job of a pawn.
Now the retreat of the rook begins
moves.33... g5 34. Be5 Kg7: Helpfully the king pins his own knight...
moves.37. Bc6: Bishop clears (and prepares for pawn advance to d7)
moves.39... Rxe8 40. Rxe8 Kf5: black is hoping to use the h4 bishop to cover d8
moves.41. Re7: However a forced exchange makes e8 the target
moves.41... Rxe7 42. dxe7 g4: A valiant attempt to stop the pawn getting home
moves.43. hxg4+: but flawed by the resulting check
